TITLE: PHA Public Housing Authority Mixed-Income Development Proposal  A Simple, Legal Structure for Building Both Workforce and Affordable Housing

Mobile Housing Authority Mixed-Income
Development Proposal

A Simple, Legal Structure for Building Both Workforce and
Affordable Housing

Executive Summary
The Mobile Housing Authority can build 200 homes for our community - 120 for working families
to buy and 80 affordable apartments for families who need rental housing. We do this by using
the profits from selling the workforce homes to help pay for the apartments. This keeps
everything legal, financially strong, and sustainable for the long term.
The Bottom Line: We make about $8.2 million profit selling homes to teachers and firefighters.
We use $4 million of that profit to cut the apartment construction debt in half. This creates
apartments with rents families can actually afford while generating over $650,000 in annual cash
flow to the Housing Authority.

How This Works: Three Simple Steps

RTS Chapel Proposal: Dual-Purpose Emergency Refuge & Worship Facility

2

Step 1: Build and Sell Workforce Homes
What We Build:
● 120 single-family homes
● Each home is 1,350 square feet
● Quality construction at $110 per square foot
The Money:
● Total cost to build: $23,943,000
● We borrow this using tax-exempt Mortgage Revenue Bonds
● We sell the homes for $285,000 each
● Total sales revenue: $32,148,000
The Result:
● After paying back the bonds and all costs
● We have $8,205,000 in profit
● This profit goes to our Master Entity (owned by Housing Authority)
Step 2: Build Affordable Apartments Using the Profit
What We Build:
● 80 apartment units (in 20 four-plex buildings)
● Each unit is 850 square feet (two bedrooms, one bath)
● Same quality construction at $110 per square foot
The Money:
● Total cost to build: $8,000,000
